edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_final

Class UI

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_final.UI

  • public class UI
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the user interface and it meant to handle interaction with the user and the game engine. This class is responsible for printing out and what the user sees and informing the user of what they can do while they are playing the game.
    Author:
    Seungyun

      private boolean quit
      Boolean to know whether or not the user decides to quit the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UI

        public UI(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_final.GameEngine game)
        This method is a constructor which takes a GameEngine object as an argument.
        Parameters:
        game - Constructor for a UI object that takes in a scanner and a Game Engine object.

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Greets user on startup and gives 3 options. Starting a new game, Loading the previous game, and quitting the game.

      • welcomeMessage

        public void welcomeMessage()
        Prints a welcome message to the user and game rules.

      • mainMenu

        private int mainMenu()
        This method returns the value of option that the user chooses.
        Returns:
        What the user sees on start up. Selection decides whether or not game is ran, loaded or quit.

      • gameLoop

        public void gameLoop()
        This method represent a game loop. It does not end until the game ends. It asks the user for several options: look, move, shoot, save, main menu, and debug mode.

      • normalEndTurn

        public void normalEndTurn()
        Runs all the methods that should take effect once the player's turn is over.

      • hardEndTurn

        public void hardEndTurn()
        This method runs hard mode methods.

      • menu

        public void menu()
        Allows the user to return to the main menu.

      • useRadar

        public void useRadar()
        Activates the radar power up if it is found by the user. Display's it's coordinates to the user.

      • playerShoot

        public void playerShoot()
        Shoots in the direction the user selects. Either Up, Down, Left, or Right.

      • playerLook

        public void playerLook()
        Reveals the two immediate spaces in any direction the user chooses. Then it allows them to Move, Shoot, Save or go back to the Main Menu.

      • playerMove

        public void playerMove()
        Moves the player across the 2D array as long

      • toggleBoard

        public void toggleBoard()
        Switches the board that is printed from game mode to debug mode.

      • checkRoom

        public void checkRoom()
        A method that runs when the player walks in front of a room. It asks if they would like to see the rooms contents and depending on whether or not the player chooses it will: tell them the contents of the room, or let them continue through.

      • changeDifficulty

        public void changeDifficulty()
        This method lets the user to change the difficulty of the game. It can be hard mode or normal mode.
